headline: CNN 10
subHeadline: Blinken To Deliver Strong Warning On Russia Support As He Arrives In China For Key Meetings; Flash Floods Displace Thousands In Kenya; School Lunches Will Have Less Added Sugar, Sodium Under New Rule. Aired 4-4:10a ET

utterances.speaker: WIRE
utterances.sentences: And this meeting comes at a tricky time for the U.S. and China. America just authorized a foreign aid package that includes $8 billion tocombat China`s growing influence in Asia. President Biden also signing a potential TikTok ban into law. It requires the social media company based out of China to find a new owner in the next few months or users in the U.S. will no longer be able to download it. Next, we head to Kenya, where more than 30 people have died after heavy rainfall led to a series of flash floods that swept almost half of the country. In total, more than 100,000 people have been affected by the severe weather. CNN`s Larry Madowo shows us the devastating impact in Nairobi, Kenya`s capital. (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: LARRY MADOWO, CNN INTERNATIONAL CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Where I`m standing used to be somebody`s house. All this area used to be people`s homes, all sweptaway. What`s getting cleared back there, that debris that`s left over, that`s what used to be their homes. In these informal settlements around Nairobi, the houses are made of wood, they`re made of iron sheets. They`re very easily swept away when there`s flooding like what was experienced. It`s a cycle. If it`s not the flooding, it`s a fire, and then flooding and a fire. And it goes on and on and on. You see a lot of people trying to collect whatever little is left of what their homes used to be, some iron sheets, maybe some valuables, trying to figure out how to rebuild their lives after a devastating situation where every single thing they owned was swept away by these flash floods. JECINTER, AGUNJA, FEMINIST ACTIVIST & MATHARE RESIDENT:  Nothing has come from the government. We only help ourselves because nobody has come to the rescue. You feel like you don`t come from this country, you are maybe inferior, because if it was somewhere else, maybe middle class or the highest class, government could have responded asap.

utterances.speaker: MADOWO
utterances.sentences: Residents in these areas, informal settlements, or slums as they`re better known, often complain about emergency services not gettingto them during disasters. But here`s the extra complication. It`s starting to rain one more time. The Kenyan Meteorological Department has warned of heavy to very heavy rainfall still to be expected. And the fear here is that that may lead to a new wave of flooding. Larry Madowo, CNN, Nairobi. (END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: WIRE
utterances.sentences: All right, next we take you to Dunsborough, Australia, where wildlife officials saved 130 pilot whales after a pod beached themselves.Sadly, rescuers couldn`t save all of them. At least 28 whales died. Rescuers rushed to hold the animals upright to keep their blow holes clear before getting them back in the water. Experts say the animals can only stay on land for about six hours before their health diminishes. Ten-second trivia. Which of these foods items is NOT included as part of the National School Lunch Program? Chocolate milk, bean burrito, potato chips, or cheese pizza? If you said potato chips, you are correct. This is a tricky one. According to the U.S. Department of Agriculture, potato chips do not contribute to any of their approved meal patterns. Mmm, lunch time. What`s your favorite school lunch? I was definitely a pizza day guy, or grilled cheese day, or turkey day. There`s not much I didn`t like. Anyway, the U.S. government wants to make school meals healthier. The Department of Agriculture just announced new rules limiting the amount of sugar and sodium in breakfasts and lunch that are served to nearly 30 million students K-12. The changes will be implemented in phases over the next few years. By the 2027-2028 school year, added sugars can`t make up more than 10% of the total weekly calories for breakfasts and lunches. The same school year, sodium needs to be cut by 15% in lunches, 10% in breakfasts. It`s the first change to school meal standards in 14 years. Today`s story, getting a 10 out of 10, has a tentaclizing twist. Nine-year- old Cal Clifford wanted a pet. A pet octopus. And he thought he got one. But he ended up with a whole lot more. CNN`s Jeanne Moos has more. (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: JEANNE MOOS, CNN CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: You may not think of octopuses as lovable, but this is the face of a kid seeing his pet octopus for the first time.Nine-year-old Cal Clifford cried with joy.

utterances.speaker: CAL CLIFFORD
utterances.sentences: You didn`t have to do this.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: When his parents gave him the tank.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: We`re going to build an octopus tank.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: The octopus itself was delivered in a plastic bag to this Oklahoma family. They named it Terrence.

utterances.speaker: CAL CLIFFORD
utterances.sentences: Terrence loves to welcome us every time we visit her. High- 8.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: As in high five, but with eight tentacles. Within weeks, Cal`s dad Cameron says --CAMERON CLIFFORD, CAL`S FATHER:  We found out that he was a she.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: And Terrence, now Terry, started acting weird, laying eggs. But no one imagined they`d been fertilized.

utterances.speaker: CAMERON CLIFFORD
utterances.sentences: The uh-oh moment was definitely when the first one hatched.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: Hatched right in dad`s hand as he examined an egg. Cal got emotional. Getting a first look at the hatchlings, suddenly one octopus hadbecome many.

utterances.speaker: CAMERON CLIFFORD
utterances.sentences: Fifty.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: Fifty babies, and each had to be cared for in a separate container.

utterances.speaker: CAMERON CLIFFORD
utterances.sentences: The babies will actually cannibalize each other.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: The baby`s got names like Jay-sea and his boo, Sea-yonce. The family learned that octopuses make for expensive pets. Leaks in the tank systemrequired vacuuming carpets and relaying ruined floors. It was all documented on TikTok.

utterances.speaker: CAMERON CLIFFORD
utterances.sentences: I wish my son`s favorite animal had been a hamster.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: Almost half of the baby octopuses survived. But Terry has died buried in the yard. Usually the mom dies after laying her eggs. The babiesare destined for educational institutions. As for Cal, he`s so into octopuses he even dressed up like one for Halloween. No wonder he was overwhelmed when I gave him his first tank.

utterances.speaker: CAL CLIFFORD
utterances.sentences: Thank you so much.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: Thanks a lot, dad and mom. Jeanne Moos, CNN, New York.(END VIDEOTAPE)
